articles.title: AI in the Pandemic: Navigating Its Potential for Rescue and Risk Management in Public Health Crises
articles.author: Dr. Priya Deshmukh
articles.summary: The COVID-19 pandemic underscored the need for rapid detection and prediction of disease outbreaks. Machine learning models were used to forecast the spread of the virus, predict hospital bed occupancy and estimate the demand for ventilators. Radiology departments were overwhelmed with chest X-rays and CT scans. AI algorithms were deployed to assist radiologists in quickly identifying signs of pneumonia. AI helped identify patients at higher risk of severe illness, allowing for prioritized access to care and tailored treatment plans.

articles.author: Suzanne Blake
articles.summary: Ohio state Representative Thad Claggett, a Republican, has sponsored a bill that would make it illegal for people to marry artificial intelligence (AI) bots. The national debate continues over whether AI regulation should be left to states or dictated from Congress.

articles.summary: Middle school students from Carroll County schools were given the opportunity to get up close and hands-on with advanced manufacturing technology and artificial intelligence on Monday. They used virtual reality headsets, controlled a robot dog and toured two buses containing various demonstrations of AI in the workplace. The event took place at 12 For Life, a partnership between Southwire and Carroll County Schools. The program serves 120 students from across five school districts.

The theme for this year's conference is 'AI for All' and it's being hosted by the Innovative Technology Action Group (ITAG) and the Chester County Economic Development Council. It's scheduled for 11:30 a.m.-5 p.m. and features presentations, panel discussions and networking opportunities.

articles.title: The not-so-subtle art of Trump's AI portraits
articles.author: Associated Press
articles.summary: On the social media accounts of Donald Trump and his second-term administration, a new, less official image of the president is emerging bit by bit: one generated artificially. It's a sign of the times when the appeal of reimagining yourself with artificial intelligence has trickled down from everyday citizens to politicians. The expressive power of political imagery is long understood by politicians and their detractors.

Q Developer's usage has increased 9-fold per person this year.

Transformer models and reinforcement learning shorten the path to value when applied to enterprise workflows such as forms, approvals, and specialized language. Base models work best when the task is a commodity and speed matters. Fine-tuning should be seen as an asset that gains value as data improves.

Research and development costs increased 23% from the prior year to 3.3 billion dollars in the second quarter. Eli Lilly has raised its dividends for 11 consecutive years and currently offers a quarterly dividend of $1.50 per share. The stock has a dividend yield of 0.83%.

The rise of powerful AI tools, particularly generative AI like ChatGPT and Copilot, is changing the equation. The future of software engineering is about leveraging AI to write code more efficiently and focusing on the strategic aspects of software development. Federal workforce cuts and shifts in industry priorities are also contributing to the slowdown of the job market.

Pennsylvania, New Jersey, and California are considering ways to regulate AI therapy. The impact on users varies. Some apps have blocked access in states with bans, while others are making no changes.

It will require certain AI developers to produce safety frameworks, reveal transparency reports and report critical safety incidents to the state Office of Emergency Services. It also makes whistleblower protections for employees who report AI safety violations. Last year, the governor vetoed a similar bill.

The routing system is designed to detect emotionally sensitive conversations and automatically switch mid-chat to GPT-5-thinking, which the company sees as the best equipped model for high-stakes safety work.

articles.title: AI recruiter Alex raises $17M to automate initial job interviews
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Alex, a startup building an AI recruiter, says it's already helping companies conduct video interviews and phone screens. Its customers include Fortune 100 companies, financial institutions, nationwide restaurant chains, and Big 4 accounting firms. Alex's new $17 million Series A round was led by Peak XV Partners.

articles.title: AI scams and fraud: 5 trends to look out for as 2025 ends
articles.author: Jeff Clemishaw
articles.summary: AI-powered scams and fraud are on the rise. Billions of dollars are lost to cybercrime every single year. OpenAI worries about AI voice fraud and its effect on banking. Consumer protection tips: Never open emails from people you don't know, be careful with links and websites with a new spelling, use preventative software for threat detection and removal.
